Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory608.jpg'}
{3: 'The transport craft slated to come has arrived, carrying resources to be delivered to other conservation areas.'}
{3: 'While they did offer to take you back to Babylonia, you kindly refused them and asked them to first finish what they came to do.'}
{3: 'Resources are life and hope—and a couple more days at Conservation Area 104 is nothing if it means the resources can be delivered to those in need as soon as possible.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg3801_10.jpg'}
{3: 'Crackle—'}
{3: 'A speck of fire pops out of the burning chunks and is gone with the wind before it even lands on the ground.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiCommon/FxUi2DLihuiFireGlow1000.prefab', 3: '1', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The firelight that dances on you and Echo strikes you as familiar.'}
{3: "It wasn't all that long ago when she told you about her past as she tried to break free of the shackles that had once held her in place."}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Are you sure you're fine staying out here?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "It's probably a lot cozier and warmer in the transport craft.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'I get to sit in there every day.', 3: '17'}
{2: "But it isn't every day that I get to camp out here.", 3: '18'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "I wouldn't call this camping when all we have is this campfire here.", 4: '1'}
{2: "And I've also got you to keep me company.", 3: '20'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: '...S-suit yourself, then...', 4: '1'}
{3: "The night wind is far from being bone-chilling cold, but you're still glad that there is a nice campfire here to keep you warm."}
{3: 'Staying in the transport craft surely would be cozier—except you would feel bad about leaving Echo out here alone.'}
{3: "And Echo probably doesn't particularly fancy the idea of getting herself stuck in that tiny space with Pickman's minions..."}
{3: "When you cast a look over Echo, you see that she's writing something down in a notebook, the firelight shining upon her."}
{3: "When gripped by writer's block, she bites the pen's cap absentmindedly, bringing to your mind the image of a diligent student grappling with some class assignment."}
{3: "She looks at you dumbfounded, her cheeks a light pink. You can't be sure if it's the firelight or a blush."}
{3: "But she quickly puts on her poker face again as she buries the notebook in her chest, seemingly not wanting you to see what she's written."}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Well, writing poems just never crossed your mind as something I'd do... did it?", 4: '1'}
{2: "It's just kind of funny to see you biting a pen's cap.", 3: '36', 4: "It's just kind of cute to see you biting a pen's cap.", 5: '44'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "What... I bit the pen's cap?! Oh, you did NOT just see that!", 4: '1'}
{3: "Looking at the pen's cap, Echo appears genuinely embarrassed—a far cry from the person she is when she fights."}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Can you please just forget what you saw, Commandant? I promise that won't happen again.", 4: '1'}
{2: "It's totally normal for you to do that when you think hard!", 3: '42', 4: "I'll try as hard as I can.", 5: '42'}
{3: 'Seeing Echo upset, you try to cheer her up, not knowing where you even read about it.'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'But you thought it was funny!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "What... I bit the pen's cap?! Oh, you did NOT just see that!", 4: '1'}
{3: "Looking at the pen's cap, Echo appears genuinely embarrassed—a far cry from the person she is when she fights."}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Can you please just forget what you saw, Commandant? I promise that won't happen again.", 4: '1'}
{2: "It's totally normal for you to do that when you think hard!", 3: '50', 4: "I'll try as hard as I can.", 5: '50'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Are you sure you weren't laughing at me just now...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Well... see, I do that myself, too...', 3: '52'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'Oh, is that so...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Echo casts a dubious stare at you.'}
{2: 'Yes, of course.', 3: '57'}
{3: 'In an attempt to seem credible, you give her a few hard nods.'}
{2: 'Uh-hum, so I see you were... writing a poem?', 3: '59'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'Well... sort of.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "It's just a way to get all these feelings off my chest.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'A real poet probably would laugh their head off reading it, though.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Says Echo, lacking her usual confidence.'}
{2: 'Knowing good students... I think that might not be the case.', 3: '64'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'What do you mean by good students...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Well, you seem super hardworking...', 3: '66'}
{2: 'And at school, when someone like you says that...', 3: '67'}
{2: 'They either hold high standards or are just being humble.', 3: '68'}

{2: 'Echo', 3: "But I'm not trying to be humble here. I've been writing poems however I want to, and I don't even really stick to all the rules and whatnot that you usually see in modern poetry.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "And I don't even write about the great and the good when I know I should...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'The "shoulds" don\'t matter when it comes to your feelings.', 3: '71'}
{3: 'Echo trails off. Then, a thought seemingly pops up in her mind. She picks up her pen and starts writing away in the notebook.'}
{3: "Moments later, she holds up the notebook to see what's written on it—before tearing the page off and feeding it to the campfire by her side."}
{2: 'Wait, what are you...', 3: '75'}
{2: "You don't like it? But you didn't really need to do that...", 3: '76'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Well... that one just now was for the refugees from today, especially those whom I couldn't save.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "And I thought it'd be better burned than kept in this notebook, for me personally.", 4: '1'}
{3: "That's when you notice that a few previous pages seem to have been torn off the notebook as well."}
{3: 'This is probably what she has been doing in memory of those who lost their lives in Utopia.'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'I was struggling with the end of that poem and couldn\'t seem to work around it—until you gave me that piece of advice about ignoring the "shoulds" just now.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Echo watches the piece of paper as the flame devours it, her eyes glistening with the firelight.'}
{3: 'Engrossed, she starts reciting the poem she wrote.'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiCommon/FxUi2DLihuiFireGlow1000.prefab', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory763.jpg'}
{3: 'In the land through which the white aurora flows we trust.'}
{3: 'From the land through which the white aurora flows we try to break free.'}
{1: 'RImgBg1DisableSlow'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory139.png'}
{3: 'The dusk swarms around us with the gray smoke,'}
{3: 'Swallowing the tears we have shed in confusion,'}
{1: 'RImgBg1DisableSlow'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg3801_08.jpg'}
{3: 'Turning them into a riverbank too far for us to ever reach.'}
{3: "As it hears the children's calls from behind,"}
{1: 'RImgBg1DisableSlow'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory627.jpg'}
{3: 'The world halts not.'}
{3: 'When the night and river stop the children hand in hand,'}
{1: 'RImgBg1DisableSlow'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg3801_15.jpg'}
{3: 'The children can be heard saying,'}
{3: '"This place should be bright as day."'}
{3: '"We shouldn\'t be looking for dawn."'}
{3: '"It\'s dawn that should be looking at us."'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg3801_10.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiCommon/FxUi2DLihuiFireGlow1000.prefab', 3: '1', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "You find yourself engrossed in the emotions carried by Echo's clear and composed voice."}
{3: 'All that can be heard now are the crackling and popping of the burning chunks.'}
{2: 'Not an expert myself, but I like it a lot.', 3: '122'}
{2: "You can post it on Babylonia's forum through your terminal.", 3: '123'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "That's never my intention... See, this is the first time I've got someone's company while wrapping up work...", 4: '1'}
{2: '"It\'s dawn that should be looking at us"...', 3: '127'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Hmm? Well, instead of seeking light... shouldn't the world simply exist in light?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "I know we aren't quite there yet, given the way things are now, and I'm not going to let anything stop me from making that happen.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "And I'm sure people who have lost their lives in our quest for justice will truly be able to rest in peace if there ever comes a day when we no longer have to seek it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Hmm... It does feel a little weird how we're having such a serious discussion about it, though...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'You need to come up with a poem and share it with me, Commandant, in the interest of being fair here!', 4: '1'}
{2: "Wait, what? But I don't know how...", 3: '135', 4: 'Sure.', 5: '139'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "That's fine. You don't really need to care about rhyming and prosody and all that. I mean...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Rules don't matter when it comes to your feelings!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "If there is a memory you're particularly fond of or a feeling you want to get off your chest, that's something you can write about!", 4: '1'}
{2: "Got it. I'll give that a try, then.", 3: '145'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'Wow, took you only a second to rise to the bait. Pretty confident there, I see.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Thought it wouldn't hurt to give it a try.", 3: '142'}
{2: "I'm sure you won't laugh, even if I write something lousy.", 3: '143'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'Of course.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'A promise is a promise, then, Commandant.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With it, Echo lets out a long sigh, seemingly relieved.'}
{2: 'Is everything okay?', 3: '150'}
{1: ' ', 2: 'Echo', 3: "I never expected this, but sharing these thoughts and feelings with you isn't as bad as I would imagine.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "It still feels a bit embarrassing for me, of course, but I can't really complain as the one who screwed up in the first place.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'Say, if poetry ends up being your cup of tea, maybe...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "...Uhm, never mind. I'll be waiting to give your poem a read, then.", 4: '1'}
